cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 240 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest then west-northwest toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City-Grand Isle area, LA

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City; Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City LA to Mouth of the Pearl River (hurricane); Cameron to west of Morgan City and Mouth of the Pearl River to MS/AL border (tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and southeast Louisiana coast and Mississippi Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph) with gusts above 50 mph possible Monday afternoon through early Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port’s inland location, though minor water level rise on the lower Mississippi River cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated amounts up to 7 inches; risk of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and hazardous river currents could disrupt operations.
